FAQs.If I am a female construction worker who: No, you would not be eligible at this time. The scheme requires female construction workers to complete at least one year of membership with the Bihar Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board before they can receive benefits.
FAQs.As a registered female construction work: You can receive maternity benefits for your first two childbirths only. The benefit amount for each eligible childbirth will be equivalent to 90 days of the state-mandated minimum wages for unskilled workers.
FAQs.What steps do I need to take to register: You need to visit the official website of the Bihar Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, click on "Apply for New Registration", provide your Aadhaar Number for authentication, fill in all mandatory fields marked with asterisk (*), and pay the application fee online to receive your registration number.
FAQs.Could you explain the complete process o: Visit the official website, click on "Scheme Application", select "Apply for Scheme", enter your registration number to view your details, select the maternity benefits scheme, fill in all mandatory information, upload required documents in the specified format and size, and click "Submit Application".
FAQs.If I register as a construction worker t: You will become eligible to apply exactly one year after your registration date, provided your membership remains active throughout this period and it is either your first or second childbirth.
FAQs.What is the exact financial assistance I: You will receive an amount equivalent to 90 days of the current minimum wages that are set by the Bihar State Government for unskilled workers at the time of your childbirth.
FAQs.As a registered construction worker, wha: Your membership must remain active at the time of application, though the provided information doesn't specify the exact requirements for maintaining active membership status. It would be best to contact the welfare board directly for these details.
FAQs.If I am currently pregnant and planning: Yes, once you complete one year of membership with the Board, you will be eligible for maternity benefits provided this is either your first or second childbirth and your membership remains active.

Scheme Name: Financial Assistance For Procuring Mobility Equipment To Disabled Ex-Servicemen (All Ranks)
Details: The scheme "Financial Assistance For Procuring Mobility Equipment To Disabled Ex-Servicemen(All Ranks)" by the Department of Ex-Servicemen Welfare of the Ministry of Defence, provide financial assistance for the procurement of modified scooter for those Ex-Servicemen (ESM), who are disabled after their retirement from service with disability of 50% or more. After their retirement, most of the ESMs continue to be engaged in physically challenging activities/work. Some of them unfortunately become handicapped due to accidents etc after their retirement and need mobility equipment such as modified scooters, crutches and wheelchairs to carry on with their life. To procure mobility requirements, the Kendriya Sainik Board (KSB) provides financial assistance to disabled ESMs from the Armed Forces Flag Day Fund (AFFDF).
Benefits: A financial assistance of a maximum of ₹ 1,00,000.
A financial assistance of a maximum of
The beneficiary can re-apply for new mobility equipment after the lapse of 10 years from the date of purchase of the previous equipment.
Eligibility: The applicant should be an Ex-Serviceman.
The applicant should be disabled after retirement from the service.
The percentage of the disability should be 50% or more.
The applicant should not be covered under a similar scheme of the Army/Navy/Air Force.
The application of the applicant should be recommended by the respective Zila Sainik Board (ZSB).
The applicant should be capable of personally utilizing the mobility equipment provided.

Offline: Step 1:  In the  Registration Form , fill in all the mandatory fields and upload the required documents.
Step 2:  Fill in the verification code, and click "Submit" to complete your registration.
Step 3:  Take a print of the submitted registration form, attach the self-attested copies of the required documents, and submit the same at the respective ZSB.
Step 1:  The Zila Sainik Welfare Office (ZSWO) will scrutinize the application, and if found correct in all respects, will forward it directly to Kendriya Sainik Board (KSB) Secretariat for payment.

Step 2:  On receipt at the KSB Secretariat, the Welfare Section-in-Charge will assign the application to a particular clerk who will enter desired data from the applications into the computer. Another clerk will be designated to check the correctness of the entries.
Step 3:  The Section-in-Charge will verify the same and put up the case in the relevant file for processing to JD(Welfare) who will obtain the approval of the Secretary, KSB.
Step 4:  After approval at KSB, the application will be processed for payment.
Step 1:  Visit the  Official Website  of the Kendriya Sainik Board (KSB) and click the “ Status of Application ”.
Step 2:  Enter your DAK ID and the verification code. Click on the “Search” button to check the status of your application.

Documents Required: Documentary evidence showing the nature of activity in which disabled.
Disability Certificate issued by Armed Forces Medical Authority, indicating nature of disability and recommended procurement of mobility equipment.
Financial estimate for a modified scooter from an authorized dealer indicating type, make and specifications of the mobility equipment.
Details of Bank A/c No (in PNB/SBI only) and IFS Code.

FAQs.What is the process for reapplying for n: After the expiration of the 10-year lifespan of the mobility equipment, beneficiaries are eligible to reapply for new equipment. They would need to follow the same application process and provide updated documentation, including a new financial estimate for the equipment. The application is then reviewed and processed as before.
FAQs.Are there any restrictions on the type o: The financial assistance can be used for any mobility equipment that aids the Ex-Serviceman's mobility needs. This can include wheelchairs, crutches, or other devices deemed necessary.
FAQs.How can applicants track the status of t: Applicants can check the status of their applications by visiting the official website of the Kendriya Sainik Board and clicking on the "Status of Application" link. They need to enter their DAK ID and verification code to check the status.
FAQs.How does the Kendriya Sainik Board (KSB): The KSB Secretariat assigns applications to clerks for data entry and verification. The Section-in-Charge and JD(Welfare) verify and process the applications, and upon approval, they are processed for payment.
FAQs.What role does the Zila Sainik Welfare O: The ZSWO plays a crucial role in scrutinizing the application. If the application is found correct in all respects, it is forwarded to the Kendriya Sainik Board (KSB) Secretariat for further processing.
FAQs.What documents are required for the appl: Applicants need to submit several documents, including their complete Discharge Book/Document/Certificate, ESM Identity Card, Disability Certificate issued by Armed Forces Medical Authority, and financial estimates for the modified scooter, among others.
FAQs.How much financial assistance is provide: The scheme provides a maximum financial assistance of ₹1,00,000 to eligible disabled Ex-Servicemen.
FAQs.What is the aim of the \"Financial Assis: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to disabled Ex-Servicemen who have a disability of 50% or more after their retirement from service. This assistance is for the procurement of modified scooters and other mobility equipment to help them lead independent lives.
FAQs.Who is eligible to apply for this scheme: To be eligible, applicants must be Ex-Servicemen who have become disabled after their retirement from service, with a disability percentage of 50% or more. They should not be covered under a similar scheme by the Army, Navy, or Air Force.

Details: The "Mentally Retarded Children Benefit Scheme'' by the BOCW Welfare Board, Department of Labour, Punjab, is a welfare scheme for the registered workers of the board. Under this scheme, the Board shall provide financial assistance for the care of mentally retarded children (son/ daughter) of construction workers.
Benefits: Financial Coverage: ₹20,000/- Per Year.
Financial Coverage:
₹20,000/- Per Year.
Eligibility: For Registration as a Building/ Construction Worker:
The applicant should be a resident of Punjab.
The applicant should be a Building/ Construction Worker (Unorganised Worker).
The applicant should be between 18 and 60 years.
The applicant should have engaged in building and construction work for at least 90 days in a given year.
The applicant should have a monthly income of ₹15,000/- or below.
The applicant should not be a member of any other Welfare Fund established under any law.
The applicant should not have membership of the Employees' Provident Fund (EPF)/ National Pension System (NPS)/ Employees' State Insurance Corporation (ESIC).
The applicant should not be an income tax payer.
For the Application of the Welfare Scheme:
The applicant should be a registered member Under the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board of Punjab.
The member should be depositing his contribution to the Board regularly.
The child of the member should be mentally retarded or disabled.

Online - via CSCsOffline: Registration Process as a Building/ Construction Worker: For new registration of workers please approach the nearby Sewa Kendra or Registering officers/ Labour Inspector. Application Process of the Welfare Scheme: To apply for benefits of the concerned welfare scheme, please approach to nearby Sewa Kendra or Registering Officers/ Labour Inspector of your area. Note: Registration with the Board:  A construction worker becomes a member of the board by filling out Application Form No 28 along with depositing registration fees of ₹ 25/- only (once in life) and ₹ 10/- per month as contribution fees. A worker at a time can get himself registered for a minimum period of 1 year & maximum period of 5 years. The registered worker is called 'Beneficiary' of the Board. Documents Required: Age proof (If no age proof is available self declaration).
Bank Account details (Bank branch, account No. and IFSC/ RTGS number).
Employer’s Certificate (Form No. 28) (90 days of construction work during the last 12 months in the State of Punjab).
Aadhaar card of Mentally retarded/ disabled Child.
Medical Certificate issued by Civil Surgeon Regarding Mentally retardness/ disability.
Joint Photo of Mentally retarded/ disabled child with Beneficiary.

Life Certificate of Mentally retarded/ disabled Child in the month of January Every Year. (Aadhaar based online life certificate through the Jeevan Pramaan Website: https://jeevanpramaan.gov.in/, which generates digital life certificate may be submitted).

FAQs.Who can register as a beneficiary under: Any construction worker whose age is between 18 to 60 years and has worked in Punjab State in any construction work for a minimum of 90 days in a year, are eligible to register as a beneficiary under the Board.
FAQs.Is there a minimum service requirement t: Yes, the building worker must have completed 90 days of service as a building worker in the preceding 12 months.
FAQs.Who can apply for the welfare scheme?: Any registered worker of the Board can apply for the welfare scheme.
FAQs.For how long a construction worker can g: A worker at a time can get himself registered for a minimum period of 1 year & maximum period of 5 years.
FAQs.What is the procedure for applying for t: Any construction worker who is of 18 years and below 60 years’ age and has Worked in Punjab State for not less than 90 days shall apply for registration as construction worker on the prescribed Form No. 28 which is available on the Board’s website or from the office of ALC/LCO and Labour Inspectors of the area.
FAQs.Whom to apply for the registration?: A construction worker who intends to get himself registered as a member of the Board shall apply to the Labour Inspector of his area.
FAQs.What are the mandatory documents for the: The documents required for registration are, age proof(If no age proof is available self declaration), residence proof, adhar card(if available), Bank Account details (Bank branch, account No. and IFSC/RTGS number), detail of dependents, and employer’s certificate of working for 90 days as construction worker, and nomination form.
FAQs.Is there a specific form for the registr: Yes, the application for registration must be made in Form No. 28.
FAQs.How much is the fee associated with the: The rate of registration fee is ₹25/- at the time of registration. It is a one time fee.
FAQs.What is the rate of contribution?: A registered worker is required to contribute ₹10/-per month as contribution fee to the Board.
FAQs.Who are the family members considered fo: Husband or wife, minor sons (including major sons who are insane or physically handicapped and unable to earn), unmarried daughters and the parents of the building worker, who are solely dependent on the registered worker.
FAQs.Who is eligible to apply for this scheme: A mentally retarded or disabled child of a registered member of the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board of Punjab, actively depositing contributions to the Board, shall be eligible for this benefit.
FAQs.What is the financial assistance provide: The scheme offers financial assistance of ₹20,000/- per year for the care of mentally retarded children.
FAQs.What are the conditions regarding the ch: The child must be mentally retarded or disabled to qualify for the benefits under this scheme.
FAQs.What form needs to be used to apply for: The application must be made in the prescribed Form No. 48 which can be downloaded from https://bocw.punjab.gov.in/userfiles/file/Disabiled%20Children%20Scheme%20Performa.pdf or can be collected from the Labour Inspectors of the concerned area.
FAQs.Whom to apply for getting benefits of we: For the application of the concerned welfare schemes of the Board, the construction worker has to visit the nearest Sewa Kendras or contact the Assistant Labour Commissioner/ Labour-cum-Conciliation Officer/ Labour Inspector/ Labour Enforcement Officer of the concerned area.

Proof regarding Submission of Registration fees.

FAQs.What is the age requirement for registra: The building worker must be at least 18 years old and not older than 60 years old.
FAQs.Is there a minimum service requirement t: Yes, the building worker must have completed 90 days of service as a building worker in the preceding 12 months.
FAQs.Who can apply for the welfare scheme?: Any registered worker of the Board can apply for the welfare scheme.
FAQs.Who is responsible for registering a wor: The officer authorized by the Board is responsible for registering the worker as a beneficiary under the Act.
FAQs.Who is eligible for registration as a be: Every building worker who is between the age of eighteen and sixty and who has been engaged in any building or other construction work for not less than ninety days during the preceding twelve months is eligible for registration as a beneficiary of the BOCW Welfare Fund under this Act.
FAQs.What is the procedure for applying for r: Application for registration is to be made in the prescribed form and is to be accompanied by prescribed documents and a fee of not more than fifty rupees.
FAQs.Where should the application for registr: The application for registration has to be made to the officer authorized by the Board.
FAQs.What is the registration fee for becomin: The registration fee is not more than fifty rupees.
FAQs.Is there a specific form for the registr: Yes, the application for registration must be made in the prescribed form. You can obtain this form from the authorized officer of the Board.
FAQs.What form needs to be used to apply for: The application must be made in the prescribed Form-VI.
FAQs.Where do I submit the application for th: Submit your welfare scheme application to the Member Secretary of the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (BOCWWB).
FAQs.What criteria must an applicant meet to: Any registered members of the board who have undergone any treatment of injuries caused during the course of employment or have served a period of disablement for any reason shall be considered for this benefit.
FAQs.How does the Board reimburse medical exp: The Board shall reimburse the actual medical expenditure incurred by the Beneficiary for treatment of injuries caused during the course of employment. This reimbursement is subject to the submission of original bills.
FAQs.What is the procedure for claiming reimb: To claim reimbursement, the Beneficiary must submit original bills for the medical treatment related to the injuries sustained during employment.
FAQs.What benefits does the Board provide for: The Board shall pay the Beneficiary half monthly wages for the period of disablement upon the submission of a Medical Certificate.
